title: Fibrosis-4 (FIB-4) Index for Liver Fibrosis
desc: The Fibrosis-4 (FIB-4) Index for Liver Fibrosis is a non-invasive scoring system based on several laboratory tests that help to estimate the amount of scarring in the liver.

orgreference.text: Sterling RK, Lissen E, Clumeck N, et. al. Development of a simple noninvasive index to predict significant fibrosis patients with HIV/HCV co-infection. Hepatology 2006;43:1317-1325.

other_refer.text: Shah AG, Lydecker A, Murray K, et al. Comparison of noninvasive markers of fibrosis in patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease. Clin Gastroenterol Hepatol. 2009;7(10):1104-12.
Tapper EB, Lok AS. Use of Liver Imaging and Biopsy in Clinical Practice. N Engl J Med. 2017;377(8):756-768.

data.evidence:
FIB-4 Score = (Age* x AST) / (Platelets x √(ALT))

*Use with caution in patients <35 or >65 years old, as the score has been shown to be less reliable in these patients.
